intro: Euphrasia serotina, commonly known as late eyebright, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. Euphrasia serotina is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat eye conditions and skin ailments.
